metadata.synopsis: First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: Piss off, you little vulture. I'm not dead yet.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: The people hunting you are. I took care of it.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: Why the change of heart? Ah, doesn't matter - thank you.
93.context: NodeContext: suspicious on first phrase, then pleased

126.speaker: Player
126.text: You will be soon - I'm taking your head.

138.speaker: Karlach
138.text: Could have sworn I told you to piss off. Maybe I imagined it.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I met the people looking for you - and killed them.

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: Oh. Sorry I told you to piss off just now. Come on over here - we should talk.
51.context: NodeContext: surprise on 'oh' - and then smilling as she apologises

143.speaker: Player
143.text: They said you're a fiend, that you belong in hell.

268.speaker: Karlach
268.text: If you killed them, I'm guessing you didn't buy their bullshit.

231.speaker: Karlach
231.text: I don't belong in hell any more than you do. But I was there.
231.context: NodeContext: matter of fact on first sentence, then preparing to tell us a cool story on the next

79.speaker: Player
79.text: You shouldn't be sorry - I'm going to kill you as well.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: I met the people looking for you. They say you're a killer - a fiend.

276.speaker: Karlach
276.text: And you believe them? Those bastards are trying to feed you a crock of shit.

193.speaker: Karlach
193.text: Hold up. One more step, and I put a bolt through your eye.
193.context: NodeContext: slumped against wall, crossbow on her lap - she raises it wearily and points it at us, then speaks with authority

178.context: CinematicNodeContext: stands, holding the crossbow in one hand, her other hand pressed to a wound on the left of her stomach. She appraises the player.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: No sudden movements, or you're dead.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.context: NodeContext: Almost like 'bring it on' - she's expecting a fight

266.speaker: Player
266.text: No, but I see you're hurt - let me help.

161.speaker: Karlach
161.text: Hurt or not, I won't miss - lung, heart, arse or eye. Take your pick.
161.context: NodeContext: small gestures with the crossbow, aiming at the bodyparts as she calls them out

253.speaker: Karlach
253.text: Tell me what you're doing here. Now.
253.context: NodeContext: About to loser her temper, but still keeping it for now

197.speaker: Player
197.text: I'm hunting a fiend - you fit the description.

245.speaker: Karlach
245.text: Somebody fed you a crock of shit, and you swallowed the lot.
245.context: NodeContext: not judging us - realising she might be able to trust us, we've just been deceived about her

225.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Karlach lowers the crossbow, grimacing in pain

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I was warned you're dangerous - so am I.

201.speaker: Karlach
201.text: If you bite as hard as you bark, we might just get along. I'm dangerous all right, but I've got no quarrel with you.
201.context: NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

89.speaker: Karlach
89.text: I reckon you've been sold a crock of shit about me.
89.context: NodeContext: starting to realise she might be able to trust us

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Don't sweat it - devils are tricky fuckers. They can't breathe without lying.
75.context: NodeContext: casually forgiving us for believing lies about her - she's very casual about devils

77.speaker: Player
77.text: They're not breathing anymore - I killed them.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Hold on - the people I spoke to were paladins, not devils.

103.speaker: Karlach
103.text: Sure they were - and I'm Tiamat's left tit.
103.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - Tiamat - TYAH-maht / tyɑ mɑt

242.speaker: Player
242.text: If you're not a fiend, what are you?

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: Are you demented? I'm a tiefling - same as you. More or less.
66.context: NodeContext: astonished by how dense we are (on the 'are you demented' variation, she's gesturing toward her horns (she's missing one) when she says more or less)

122.speaker: Karlach
122.text: I guess they told you I bite the heads off babies, and paint myself in their blood.
122.context: NodeContext: as if telling an exaggerated story about a boogeyman

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Truth's not quite so exciting. Come on over and I'll tell you the whole story.
20.context: NodeContext: friendly, gesturing for us to come closer - we're still across the river at this point.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: I'm a fugitive - escaped from the Hells, and those bastards are trying to take me back.
81.context: NodeContext: an incredible story delivered as if it's everyday life

184.speaker: Player
184.text: You were in hell? So was I, not long ago.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I visited Avernus recently - seemed delightful.

191.speaker: Narrator
191.text: *As she winces, agony shoots through you, as if your bodies share the same wound.*
191.context: NodeContext: She clutches her side, wincing

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies, as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*

256.speaker: Narrator
256.text: *The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the frontline.*

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: Ster'ca. What was that? You were inside my head...
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: she's startled, angry - her eyes flash with fireNodeContext: ster'ca (stir-KA (very harsh KA)) is a curse word in infernal language. She's shocked, a little afraid of us

233.speaker: Karlach
233.text: That was one of my good days - the bad ones would knock you sick.

198.speaker: Karlach
198.text: Now tell me what you just did to me before I make sure you can never do it again.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: It wasn't me - it's the parasites from the mind flayer ship. They connected us.

207.speaker: Karlach
207.text: Hold on a minute - you were on that ship? With the tentacles, and the worms?
207.context: NodeContext: we just surprised her - first phrase is like 'woah, slow down' energy.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: I didn't think anyone else had survived.
72.context: NodeContext: amazed and a slight touch of guilt - if she'd known there were survivors she might have stuck around to help

230.speaker: Player
230.text: I didn't see you aboard. Where were you?

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: I boarded in Avernus - that ship was my way out.
48.context: NodeContext: simple explanation of fantastical event - Avernus = hell

240.speaker: Karlach
240.text: No - I just saw a chance and I took it.

171.speaker: Karlach
171.text: That ship could have been heading for Sigil or Limbo for all I cared - anything was better than staying.
171.context: NodeContext: with a shrug, summarising her improvised escape plan Sigil - /ˈsɪdʒ ɪl/

188.speaker: Player
188.text: Stowing away aboard a mind flayer's nautiloid? Pretty stupid.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: If you'd seen as much of hell as I have, you'd rather have a flayer's tentacles up your arse than stay.
54.context: NodeContext: making a serious point, but drily amused

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: And I'll be going straight back if those imp-fuckers catch me.
82.context: NodeContext: 'straight back' to hell. said with concern. the 'imp-fuckers' are cultists

65.speaker: Player
65.text: What makes you so important to them?

172.speaker: Karlach
172.text: I was a prisoner, forced to fight in the Blood War - the eternal battle between bad and worse.
172.context: NodeContext: casually summarising cosmic events as if they're everyday

135.speaker: Karlach
135.text: Most souls in Avernus are just meat for the grinder. But not me.

149.speaker: Karlach
149.text: I held my own. More than. Turns out I've got a knack for killing demons - and I enjoy it. That made me a valuable asset.
149.context: NodeContext: she's enjoying telling us this - bigging herself up and relishing it

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: Devils don't like to lose their assets.
30.context: NodeContext: doomed resignation - here's her central problem - she's the 'asset' in this case

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Hard to believe you're a demon-slayer when you can't deal with a few cultists.

173.speaker: Karlach
173.text: Back in the Blood War, my commander gave me what I needed to get the job done. I had fire running through my veins.
173.context: NodeContext: Explaining in a matter of fact way. last sentence is with a smile - remembering it fondly. The fire running through her veins is a reference to having hellish magical abilities

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: I don't work for her anymore so I'm back to relying on muscle and steel - I'll be just fine.
22.context: NodeContext: "I'll be just fine" with a smile. She's tough and she knows it.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: So you want me to kill the people hunting you?

250.speaker: Karlach
250.context: NodeContext: punching her fist into her palm and grinning

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: They cornered me in the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the beating I gave them.
121.context: NodeContext: explaining the situation, pleased we're helping

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: I'd come with you just to see them bleed, but I'm too busy bleeding myself. I'll be here when you're done.
9.context: NodeContext: gestures at the wound in her side (same one she was clutching earlier) on 'too busy bleeding myself'. She's fairly casual about how much she's bleeding

136.speaker: Karlach
136.text: Figures. I'll see you in hell one day, arsehole.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: What do I get in return?

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: You get a friend who spat in Baphomet's eye and lived to tell the tale.
68.context: NodeContext: cocky, with a big grin - Baphomet (Baff-oh-met)

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: They're not the kind of people you can run from. I need them dead.
8.context: NodeContext: dismissing a suggestion to run

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I'm not doing it - you're on your own.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: And they need you dead - I'm ending you.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'm done listening - I'm ending you.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Judging by the wound, I'm guessing they already found you.

166.speaker: Karlach
166.text: Yeah. Not far from here - gang of cultists cornered me in an abandoned tollhouse.

177.speaker: Karlach
177.text: I took out a couple, but I need them all dead.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: If I do this, what do I get in return?

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: A gang of cultists cornered me in an abandoned tollhouse, not far from here.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: I don't believe a word of this.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Why were you in hell in the first place?

6.speaker: Player
6.text: They don't need to catch you - I already did. You're finished.

3.speaker: Karlach
3.text: Ha. Even if you take me, I'll see you in hell one day. And I'll rip your godsdamned spine out.
3.context: NodeContext: short, performative and dismissive 'ha'. Then threatening and relishing the chance to fight us

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: You gave me some breathing room when you killed those imp-fuckers, but more will come.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: Why are you so important to them?

117.speaker: Karlach
117.text: Most souls in the Blood War are just meat for the grinder, but not me.
117.context: NodeContext: proud, grinning, enjoying bigging herself up

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Safety in numbers? Not a bad idea.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Sorry - I left all my soul coins in hell.
5.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - soul coins are the currency of hell

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: But I won't forget what you did, and I hope I can pay you back down the line.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: You must have got clear of the crash site in a hurry.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: The place would have been crawling with cultists if I'd stuck around - and they'd have dragged us all back to Avernus.
92.context: NodeContext: calmly explaining a bad situation - Avernus = hell

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I didn't do it on purpose.

217.speaker: Karlach
217.text: That's what I thought - it was something inside you. I felt it. One of those godsdamned worms, from the ship.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: That was the least of what I can do.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: I'll knock your teeth down your throat if you keep playing games - this is serious. What was that?
33.context: NodeContext: threatening, but still curious, especially on last phrase

235.speaker: Player
235.text: Hold up - you fought in the Blood War?

246.speaker: Karlach
246.context: NodeContext: proud, but making out it's no big deal

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Yes, and I saw hell. You really are a fiend.

108.speaker: Karlach
108.text: Fuck this - I'm done being reasonable.

145.speaker: Karlach
145.text: It's not - it's a shitting catastrophe. But at least I'm out.
145.context: NodeContext: agreeding with our assessment of her situation

219.speaker: Player
219.text: I know - and I can save their souls by killing you.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I know - they offered a fine reward for your head. I intend to claim it.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: You said yourself, devils are tricksters. I don't believe a word of this.

174.speaker: Karlach
174.text: You're picking the wrong side here - those bastards aren't what they claim to be.
174.context: NodeContext: irritated, but trying to convince us to take her side

183.speaker: Player
183.text: All right, I'm listening - what's really going on here?

203.speaker: Player
203.text: They told me you'd slaughtered innocent families.

267.speaker: Karlach
267.text: Bullshit. I've never killed anyone who didn't deserve it.
267.context: NodeContext: harsh on bullshit - adamant on rest

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Awful lot of people do deserve it though, don't you find?
11.context: NodeContext: thoughtful - she's talking about people who deserve to be killed

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Not another word - I'm ending you.

39.speaker: Karlach
39.context: NodeContext: we just threatened to kill her and she's relishing the fight - convinced she'll kick our asses

274.speaker: Karlach
274.text: But if you do cut me down - I'll see you in the Hells one day and return the favour. Count on it.
274.context: NodeContext: we just threatened to kill her and she's relishing the fight - convinced she'll kick our asses

116.speaker: Player
116.text: If you keep pointing that thing at me this is going to end badly for you.

181.speaker: Karlach
181.text: Hm. If you bite as hard as you bark, we might get along. I might even have a job for you.
181.context: NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

277.speaker: Karlach
277.text: Cute. I've scraped more frightening things than you off my boot.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Either piss off, or show me what you're made of.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I just want to know what's going on here, I swear.

110.speaker: Karlach
110.text: All right. Maybe the blood-loss is making me soft, but I'm going to trust you. For now.
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers the crossbow, grimacing in painNodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: I'm in a tight spot - might not be able to get out of it alone.
59.context: NodeContext: annoyed she has to admit this - she's used to being self-dependent

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Maybe I can help - fill me in.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Oh, I have. The kind of battles a cub like you sees in their nightmares.
19.context: NodeContext: 'cub' as a minor insult about our combat experience - trying to intimidate us a little. Enjoying it

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: I'm having a very bad day.
221.context: NodeContext: we just said she was very intense, she's like 'well, yes'

88.speaker: Player
88.text: You've got my attention - what's your story?

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: All right. Come on over here. But fair warning - you might find this hard to believe.
1.context: NodeContext: allowing us to come closer - she's going to tell us her story and it's intense

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: I'm a fugitive. I escaped the Hells, and the bastards who were holding me there are trying to take me back.
26.context: NodeContext: an incredible story delivered as if it's everyday life

168.speaker: Player
168.text: If I help you, what's in it for me?

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: You get a friend who'll put a dent in the skull of anyone who pisses you off.
154.context: NodeContext: describing herself - matter of fact and quite friendly

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: I'm good at reading people - there's a knack to it -  and I'm only getting one word from you.
14.context: NodeContext: appraising us, unimpressed - the one word, in her next line, is 'horseshit'

175.speaker: Karlach
175.context: NodeContext: dismissive - summarising what we just said in one word - thinks we're liars

263.speaker: Karlach
263.text: Piss off, or show me what you're made of.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: And I'm none of yours. So piss off.
84.context: NodeContext: responding 'none of your damn business' - very aggressive on final phrase

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Yes I am - the people who are hunting you sent me.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I have no idea who you are.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: You just happened to stumble across me, here in the arse-end of nowhere? Bullshit.
69.context: NodeContext: doesn't believe a word of it

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I met the others who were sent for you - told them I'd help.

211.speaker: Karlach
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: clutches her wounded side as she greets usNodeContext: grimace of pain as she greets us

252.speaker: Karlach
252.context: NodeContext: resignation that her troubles aren't over on 'for now', then gratitude

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Her mind touches yours - gratitude, warmth, and relief.*

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *Then a light, sharper than the truest blade, brighter than a star. It fills you with awe, forcing you to your knees.*

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *And from within, a winged figure steps forward, graceful and terrible. She places her hand on your cheek.*

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *And smiles as she carves her name across your chest.*

167.speaker: Karlach
167.context: NodeContext: gasping, in shock, speaking to the person in her vision rather than to us. Defiant. Infernal language - means 'I don't belong to you'. (Qua-ad voss none pet-ree-kah)

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: Her words are spoken in the infernal tongue of devils. A threat, or a plea: 'I don't belong to you'.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: She thinks she owns you? Who is she?

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: Zariel. Fallen lady, defiled celestial... ruler of Avernus. I was her prisoner, and her champion.
37.context: NodeContext: Building up to the reveal on 'ruler of Avernus'. She's describing an archdevil - it's a big deal. Zariel (ZAR-ee-el)

192.speaker: Karlach
192.text: The paladins you killed were acting on her orders - she'll send more. And worse.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: What will you do if she sends more?

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: Oh, I'm counting on it. I'll be ready for her.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: And the first step is to go home - to Baldur's Gate. I've got a score to settle.
78.context: NodeContext: continuing with the determination - she's going to kick someone's ass

273.speaker: Player
273.text: Not many people survive an archdevil's fury.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: I haven't survived her yet. She'll come for me - and I'll need to be ready.
64.context: NodeContext: making it clear her battle isn't over, grimly determined

257.speaker: Player
257.text: Who was that? In your memory?

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I've never heard that language before.

104.speaker: Karlach
104.text: Lucky you. It's the devils' tongue - infernal. Good for cursing and counting, not so good for small talk.
104.context: NodeContext: faint smile on 'lucky you'. Then trying to make a joke about something awful

215.speaker: Karlach
215.text: I'm going from one hell straight into another - home, to Baldur's Gate. I've got a score to settle.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: I could use the company, but until I've shaken Zariel off my back, I'd only put a target on yours.
12.context: NodeContext: regretting turning down our offer to join our party - but convinced it's for our own good

232.speaker: Karlach
232.text: My advice? Stay away from the city. When I catch up with the fuckers who did this to me, the streets will run red.
232.context: NodeContext: relishing this - she's heading out on a bloody revenge spree and she's really looking forward to it

248.speaker: Player
248.text: My offer still stands - let's travel together.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: Who are you looking for in the city?

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: Politicians. The fuckers who sent me to hell in the first place.
156.context: NodeContext: describing her enemies - she really doesn't like them

186.speaker: Karlach
186.text: My advice? Stay away from the city. When I catch up with them, the streets will run red.
186.context: NodeContext: relishing this - she's heading out on a bloody revenge spree and she's really looking forward to it

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Aren't you worried about what the parasite's doing to you?

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: And what is it doing to me exactly? I barely felt a wriggle from it 'til you came along.
7.context: NodeContext: talking about the parasite - she's not concerned about it, more curious

190.speaker: Player
190.text: It'll turn you into a mind flayer.

222.speaker: Karlach
222.text: Doesn't seem to have turned you into a mind flayer, unless you've tucked your tentacles down your throat.

224.speaker: Karlach
224.text: I'll start worrying when it gives me a reason to.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: Take your time - it's only my soul on the line.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: I decided to help them instead. I'm taking your head.
